meanings.definition: Prevent or prohibit someone from doing something
meanings.sent1: The locked gate debars entry into the restricted area.
meanings.sent2: The school rules debars students from using their phones in class.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel debars the birds from reaching the bird feeder.
meanings.sent4: The thick fog debars visibility on the road, making driving dangerous.
meanings.sent5: The strict referee debars any form of cheating during the game.

meanings.definition: Exclude or ban someone from a place or activity
meanings.sent1: The bouncer debars underage individuals from entering the club.
meanings.sent2: The security guard debars unauthorized personnel from entering the building.
meanings.sent3: The grumpy cat debars the dog from sitting on its favorite cushion.
meanings.sent4: The heavy rain debars us from having a picnic in the park.
meanings.sent5: The judge debars the disruptive spectator from the courtroom.
